Ingredients.4: 5  chicken drumsticks, or more to taste

Ingredients.11: 0.25 gallons water, or more as needed

Ingredients.15: 0.5 pounds Spanish pumpkin, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks

Ingredients.16: 1 pound sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks

Ingredients.17: 1 pound eddeos, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks

Ingredients.18: 0.5 pound yuca (cassava) roots, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks

Ingredients.19: 0.5 pound potatoes, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks

Ingredients.20: 2  green plantains, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks

Ingredients.21: 2 ears corn on the cob, cut into quarters

Ingredients.23: 2 large carrots, chopped, or more to taste

Directions.1: Mash garlic, oregano, and 1 teaspoon salt together in a bowl.

Directions.2: Douse chicken, beef, and pork with lemon juice in a large bowl. Drain half the liquid. Mix the mashed garlic, half of the onions, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, and vinegar into the meat mixture.

Directions.3: Heat the remaining 1/2 cup vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meat mixture in batches and cook until browned on all sides, 15 to 20 minutes.

Directions.4: Transfer the browned meats into a large pot. Add half of the water, chicken broth, beef consomme, 2 bouillon cubes, and 1 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until meats are more than halfway cooked through, about 40 minutes.

Directions.5: Combine pumpkin, sweet potatoes, eddeos, yuca, potatoes, plantains, corn, celery, carrots, green pepper, cilantro, and adobo seasoning in the simmering pot. Return soup to a boil. Reduce heat to low and continue simmering until the sancocho is thick and the root vegetables are soft, 1 to 2 hours. Stir in the remaining half of the water by gradual increments to replace any evaporated liquid.
